changesets.title: Fix backslash replacement in unescapeFormat function
changesets.body:
## Bug Fix in Core Library

### Issue
The `unescapeFormat` function in `src/lib/parse/regex.js` had a critical bug where it only replaced the first backslash in a string. The original implementation used `s.replace('\\', '')`, which only removes the first occurrence of a backslash.

### Fix
Modified the replacement to use a global regex `s.replace(/\\/g, '')` to remove all backslashes in the string.

### Impact
- Ensures consistent backslash removal across the entire input string
- Prevents potential parsing issues caused by partial backslash removal
- Improves the reliability of the regex parsing mechanism

### Commit Details
- File modified: `src/lib/parse/regex.js`
- Function updated: `unescapeFormat()`

Resolves an important parsing bug in the Core Library subsystem.

commits.message: Fix the bug in the unescapeFormat function in src/lib/parse/regex.js where it only replaces the first backslash in a string. The function currently uses s.replace('\\', '') which only replaces the first backslash. This should be changed to use a global regex replacement like s.replace(/\\/g, '') to replace all backslashes in the string.
